messages: 2e8a6e25c88815371e75aa5194c04ada (23:51): is <div> only used in html, not css ?
99821775265f8e3df9b2f0bac4b79a1f (23:51): what do you mean?
2e8a6e25c88815371e75aa5194c04ada (23:52): can i use div.menuLeft in css and then <div class=menuLeft />
2e8a6e25c88815371e75aa5194c04ada (23:52): or <div id=menuLeft />
2e8a6e25c88815371e75aa5194c04ada (23:52): i understand how <div> can be used for layout, but don't quite understand how to use it in css layout?
99821775265f8e3df9b2f0bac4b79a1f (23:53): html:<div id="menuleft">content</div>  ||  css: #menuLeft { attributes; }
99821775265f8e3df9b2f0bac4b79a1f (23:54): or html: <div class="menuLeft">content</div>  ||  css: div.menuLeft { attributes; }

6acb68879ad583eb6a101ee7fdd451e7 (00:01): any thoughts on whether or not form areas (input/select/etc with their label tag) are more semantically enclosed in <p> vs. <div> ?
2e8a6e25c88815371e75aa5194c04ada (00:22): so, rockswontcry i can use div.menuLeft ?  this is what i thought
2e8a6e25c88815371e75aa5194c04ada (00:24): ah, ok, i got it. id for # and class for tag.class

e15c57f4977ccd4b1d78eaec191088e3 (00:36): can anyone assist me with css vertical centering of an image? i have tried to use margins to center it.. i have css defining the page width/height as 100%... and have the image under <div> and <span> tags
e15c57f4977ccd4b1d78eaec191088e3 (00:36): but it just wont center
2e8a6e25c88815371e75aa5194c04ada (00:41): <img align="center" />

e15c57f4977ccd4b1d78eaec191088e3 (01:04): well apparently, CSS is too damn weak to permit vertically positioning

e15c57f4977ccd4b1d78eaec191088e3 (01:04): which is really stupid just for the purpose of centering one image
e15c57f4977ccd4b1d78eaec191088e3 (01:04): but if it works its worth it
e15c57f4977ccd4b1d78eaec191088e3 (01:04): vertical*
